Fee Schedule shall be the responsibility of the property owner.
   (b)   Fees for water connection shall be in accordance with the Fee
Schedule.
   (c)   In the event that the Water Superintendent determines that a water tap
should be changed in conjunction with and/or as the result of a City paving
project, the property owner will be charged for the material costs only
pursuant to the Fee Schedule.
(Ord. 29-23. Passed 3-13-23.)
943.04 BILLING.
   (a)   An authorized representative of the Water Department shall read the
water meters of customers of the Water Department, but under no circumstances
will a water meter not be read at least once during a six (6) month period.
   (b)   If a meter fails to register, or if the meter is unable to be
inspected for that particular month, a consumption for the month shall be
estimated from the consumption for previous months when water was supplied
under similar conditions and was visually inspected.
   (c)   If a consumer is dissatisfied with registration of the meter and
requests that it be tested, the Water Department shall make such tests after
the consumer has deposited the amount specified in the Fee Schedule. If the
meter is found to over-register by an amount exceeding 2- 1/2%, another meter
will be furnished at no cost to the consumer, the proper reduction shall be
made on the Water bill and the meter testing fee will be refunded.
(Ord. 24-05. Passed 2-14-05.)
   (d)   Water bill is due and payable monthly as billed at the office of the
Water Department for the City of Conneaut on the fourteenth (14th) day after
the date of the billing. Bills remaining unpaid after the fourteenth (14th) day
after the date of the billing shall be subject to termination as specified
under subparagraphs (e) or (f). (Ord. 72-12. Passed 8-27-12.)
   (e)   If the water bill is not paid in full on its due date, the Water
Department shall send a notice that failure to pay the bill within fourteen
(14) days will result in termination of service. Failure to pay the past due
amount prior to disconnection will result in a late fee being charged, even if
no disconnection is made, pursuant to Section
110.10(a) of the Conneaut Codified Ordinances. (Ord. 81-17. Passed 11-27-17.)
   (f)   Consumers who are unable to make payment on their water bills as they
become due because of economic hardship shall, at the discretion of the City
Manager or his authorized representative, be allowed to enter into a staggered
payment schedule that shall not exceed three (3) months. This agreement shall
be signed by the consumer and by the authorized representative of the City
Manager and shall continue in effect for three (3) months insofar as the
conditions are met. Violations of any part of the agreement may result in
immediate termination of water services.
   (g)   Water shut off for non-payment shall not be turned on again until the
account is paid in full and a fee in accordance with the Fee Schedule is paid
to the City Water Department to cover the cost of re-installing service during
normal working hours, a higher charge in accordance with the rate schedule
shall be assessed to the consumers for re-installation of services after normal
working hours. Such fee shall be paid before the water service is reconnected.
The City Manager expressly reserves the right to adjust said fees to cover
future increases in the cost of materials and labor.
   (h)   If a metered water bill seems excessive to the consumer, the consumer
should file a written complaint as soon as possible with the Water Department
at 294 Main Street, Conneaut, OH 44030. The Water Department shall take steps
to reread the meter and provide reasonable assistance to the customer to
determine a reason for any water loss and may propose an adjustment to the bill
if the cause is beyond the control of the customer.
   (i)   Waterline extensions constructed by the City will recover all costs
including labor, equipment, rental, materials and any other associated costs.
(Ord. 24-05. Passed 2-14-05.)
943.05 REPAIRS.
   Water mains may be shut off by the City in case of accident, or for the
purpose of making connections, alterations or repairs. The Department will make
very effort to provide prior notice to all consumers within the district
affected, except in cases of emergency.
(Ord. 24-05. Passed 2-14-05.)
943.06 DISCONTINUANCE OF SERVICE.
   Any consumer wishing to discontinue water service must give notice to the
office of the Water Department at least two (2) working days prior to service
being terminated. Such person must be the same person that authorized the
service in the beginning or his legal representative. Such consumer must also
make a statement that there are no other persons living in such residence that
will be adversely affected by the discontinuance of service. If that consumer
indicated that there is a person living at the residence that will be adversely
affected by such discontinuance, he shall provide the name and address of such
person to the Water Department. The Water Department shall provide notice to
that person that the water is to be turned off, and shall give such person
thirty (30) days notice that he or she must come in and register his or her
name and make the required application as stated in Section A of these Rules
and Regulations. In no instance will water service be terminated by the Water
Department until it has taken reasonable steps to assure that persons adversely
affected by the discontinuance of this water service under the above
circumstances have had ample time to contact the Water Department and have the
service put in their name. Until the above requirements are fulfilled, the
responsibility for the water bill remain with the person who initially
requested the service.
(Ord. 24-05. Passed 2-14-05.)
943.07 ENFORCEMENT.
   (a)   The City of Conneaut shall conduct or cause to be conducted an initial
assessment and periodic surveys or investigations of water use practices within
a consumer's premises to determine whether there are actual or potential cross-
connections to the consumer's water system through which contaminants or
pollutants could backflow into the public water system or determine where in
the judgment of the City, a pollutional system, health or severe health hazard
to the public water system exists. Such inspections, by the City, shall be made
between the hours of 9:00 a.m. and 4:00 p.m. or other agreed upon time and date
and the City shall at all times cooperate with the applicant in setting up a
date and time for such inspections.
   (b)   The City inspector shall present proper identification to the owner,
agent or present occupant of the premises before entering.
   (c)   (1)    In order to safeguard the safety, health and welfare of the
public, the Water Treatment Superintendent or his/her duly designated
representative, is authorized to gain consensual entry to any dwelling or
premises, and any parts thereof, at any reasonable time for the purpose of
making surveys and investigations of water use practices within the premises.
      (2)    If any owner, occupant, or other person in charge of a premises
subject to the provisions of this code refuses, impedes, inhibits, interferes
with, restricts or obstructs entry and free access to any part of the dwelling
or premises where inspection authorized by this code is sought, the Water
Treatment Superintendent, or his/her duly designated representative, shall
be permitted to seek, in a court of competent jurisdiction, a warrant for
administrative inspection. Nothing in this ordinance shall be construed to
state or imply that anyone refusing consensual entry is committing a criminal
offense.
      (3)   Any warrant for administrative inspection shall allow for the
inspection of the subject premises, and any parts thereof, pursuant to the
provisions of this code and shall be so limited in scope.
      (4)    Nothing herein shall be construed to limit the authority of the
Water Treatment Superintendent, or his/her duly designated representative, to
gain access to any premises in emergency circumstances or otherwise pursuant to
law.
   (d)   Notice of Violation. If during an inspection, the Water Treatment
Superintendent or his/her duly designated representative determines a cross-
connection or hazard exists, the Water Treatment Superintendent or his/her duly
designated representative shall issue a Notice of Violation to the owner of the
property, and to the occupant, if applicable, via personal service or USPS
Certificate of Mailing. The Notice shall provide the owner with a period of no
more than ten (10) days to make the appropriate repairs and shall specifically
list the actions required to remedy the violation(s).
   (e)   Failure to Comply. In the event that the owner/occupant of any
premises fails to comply with a notice of violation within the time period
specified in said notice, the Water Treatment Superintendent or his/her duly
designated representative shall cause such violation to be corrected, removed,
or abated. The Water Treatment Superintendent or his/her duly designated
representative may contract with a private person or firm to accomplish said
task. The actual cost of bringing the premises into compliance plus fifteen
percent (15%) for inspections and administration shall be billed to the owner
and/or occupant. If said bill is not paid within thirty days after submission
then the Finance Director shall certify said costs together with a ten percent
(10%) penalty to the Ashtabula County Auditor for placement on the tax
duplicate to be collected as other taxes for return to the City. The Water
Treatment Superintendent may also petition for a preliminary or permanent
injunction restraining the owner/occupant from activities that would create
further violations or compelling the owner/occupant to perform abatement or
remediation of the violation.
   (f)   Owners not supplying required meter and backflow preventer testing
documentation, or not replacing an inaccurate meter, or otherwise violating
this Ordinance shall be fined one hundred dollars ($100.00) per day until the
requirements are met. The City reserves the right to terminate service if the
required testing becomes more than thirty (30) days past due or if it presents
an imminent threat to public health and safety.
(Ord. 05-21. Passed 2-22-21.)
943.08 RATES AND FEES.
   (a)   It is hereby ordered that for the purpose of paying the expenses of
conducting and managing the Water Department of the City of Conneaut there be
and hereby is assessed upon all consumers supplied with water by the City of
Conneaut rates and fees described herein. Nevertheless, the City Manager and/or
Council of the City of Conneaut expressly reserve the right to adjust said
rates and fees to cover future increases in the cost of materials and labor.
   (b)   Fee Schedule.
   Rates and fees for Section
943.08(b) shall be as established by ordinance and amended as necessary. Said
rates and fees are located within Chapter
110 of the Codified Ordinances of the City of Conneaut.
   These By-Laws and Regulations may be amended, repealed or supplemented at
any time by the City Manager.
(Ord. 79-14. Passed 9-22-14.)

953.01  GRAVE OPENINGS AND GRAVE PURCHASES.
   (a)   Fees for the Municipal Cemetery are listed in Section
110.11 of this code.
   (b)   The City will designate specific sections within the East Conneaut and
Glenwood Cemeteries where monuments shall be permitted. Said monuments shall be
required to have a four inch (4") cement foundation/border. The City shall also
designate areas within said cemeteries for ground level head stones.
(Ord. 30-23. Passed 3-13-23.)
953.02  INDIGENT DECEDENT.
   (a)   “Indigent decedent” shall be defined herein as any person who has died
leaving no assets to pay for burial services and no relatives to assume the
cost of burial services.
   (b)   Any indigent decedent shall not be required to pay the grave opening
fee which has previously been established by this chapter.
   (c)   With respect to indigent burials and pursuant to Ohio R.C. 5101.521,
the City has an obligation to provide, at its cost, a grave/burial site and a
stone or concrete marker inscribed with the deceased person’s name and age, if
known, and the date of death.
   (d)   Indigent burial costs are subject to approval by the City Manager in
accordance with guidelines for indigent burials established by the City Manager
and Council.
(Ord. 63-06. Passed 6-12-06.)

   The City Administration shall promulgate rules and regulations governing

and fees.

CHAPTER 958
Parks and Recreation
 
958.01   Establishment of City parks.
958.02   Hours of use.
958.03   Regulation of parks.
958.04   Usage of parks.
958.05   Weapons and firearms. (Repealed)
958.06   Alcoholic beverages.
958.07   Animals - pets, dogs, cats.
958.08   Lake View Park and trailer park/camp ground. (Repealed)
 
958.01 ESTABLISHMENT OF CITY PARKS.
   The following properties owned by the city are hereby designated as city
parks
   (a)    Liberty Park, located on Liberty Street, School Street, and Main
Street;
   (b)    Lakeview Park, located on Sandusky Street and Erie Street;
   (c)    Port of Conneaut Marine Memorial Park, located on Day Avenue and Park
Avenue.
      (Ord. 110-23. Passed 9-11-23.)
 
958.02 HOURS OF USE.
   (a)    Parks shall be open to the public daily between the hours of 7:00
a.m. until dusk. It shall be unlawful for any person other than city personnel
conducting city business therein to occupy or be present in the park during any
hours in which the park is not open to the public. Exception shall be those
parks that provide lighting for evening activities such as Lakeview Park, which
shall be open from 7:00 am to 11:00 pm for scheduled activities.
 
   (b)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a minor misdemeanor.
(Ord. 95-12. Passed 11-26-12.)
 
958.03 REGULATION OF PARKS.
   In addition to those provided for in this chapter, the Parks and Recreation
Commission shall propose rules, regulations, hours of operation, and fees
necessary for the enjoyment of the city parks for adoption by the City Council.
(Ord. 95-12. Passed 11-26-12.)
 
958.04 USAGE OF PARKS.
   (a)    All persons using park property shall dispose of litter in
receptacles provided.
 
   (b)    No persons shall pollute any lake, stream, creek, ditch, drain, or
waterways.
 
   (c)    No person shall build a fire except in an approved appliance and
every person shall extinguish all fires prior to leaving the area.
 
   (d)    It shall be unlawful for any person to use any amplified music device
while on any park property which may be disruptive to the use of the park.
 
   (e)    All persons shall pay appropriate fees for use of the park as
approved by the City Council.
 
   (f)    No person may hunt, trap, feed, or endanger animals or birds in any
way except fishing unless authorized by the City Council.
 
   (g)    No camping shall be allowed in any park, unless otherwise authorized
by the City Council.
 
   (h)    No person shall operate any recreational vehicles in any park, unless
otherwise authorized by the City Council for use during an approved event.
 
   (i)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a minor misdemeanor.
(Ord. 95-12. Passed 11-26-12.)
 
958.05  WEAPONS AND FIREARMS. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
958.05 was repealed by Ordinance 69-17.)
 
958.06  ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES.
   (a)    Possession of and/or Consumption of Alcoholic Liquor while in city
parks, it shall be unlawful for any person to possess or consume alcoholic
beverages on any park property unless prior approval is granted by the City
Council and insurance acceptable to the city insurance carrier is provided.
 
   (b)   Whoever violates this section is guilty of a minor misdemeanor.
(Ord. 95-12. Passed 11-26-12.)
 
958.07 ANIMALS - PETS, DOGS, CATS.
   (a)   It shall be unlawful for any person to allow or otherwise permit any
pet, dog, or cat, or other domesticated animal to be upon any park property
unless leashed or restrained at all times and under the specific physical
control of the person who owns or has legal custody of said animal and in
conformance with Chapter
505. Leashes must be no longer than six (6) feet in length. All persons who
bring animals, as described above, onto property must have proof that the
animal has a current valid rabies inoculation and valid license.
 
   (b)    It shall be unlawful for any person to bring or keep a noisy,
vicious, or dangerous animal, onto park property and remain thereon after
having been asked to leave by a city official, law enforcement officer, or
employee.
 
   (c)    It shall be unlawful for any person bringing said animal, as
heretofore described, not to remove and dispose of its animal waste in proper
containers from park premises.
 
   (d)    Whoever violates this section is guilty of a minor misdemeanor.
(Ord. 95-12. Passed 11-26-12.)
 
958.08 LAKE VIEW PARK AND TRAILER PARK/CAMP GROUND. (REPEALED)
   (EDITOR’S NOTE: Former Section
958.08 was repealed by Ordinance 111-23, passed September 11, 2023.)
 
CHAPTER 959
Garbage and Rubbish Collection and Disposal
959.01   Purpose.
959.02   Definitions.
959.03   Residential garbage and rubbish collection.
959.04   Waste collection; franchise agreement.
959.05   Licensing of contractors.
959.06   Conditions of hauling permit.
959.07   Recycling.
959.20   Duties of owners, landlords and tenants.
959.30   General prohibitions.
959.99   Penalty.
959.01 PURPOSE.
   It is the desire of the City Council to encourage for the proper disposal of
refuse in the City as well as to provide regulations for the same for the
Health, Safety, and Welfare of the Community. (Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
959.02 DEFINITIONS.
   (a)    “Commercial and/or industrial waste" shall mean all rubbish, trash,
refuse and garbage of any kind that has been generated in any business or
commercial setting. This definition shall include, but shall not be limited to,
waste generated by wholesale and/or retail establishments, manufacturing
businesses, industrial businesses, office environments, all service
establishments, new and refurbishing construction sites, and any and all places
of business. For purposes of this chapter, "commercial and/or industrial waste"
shall include waste generated at condominiums, multiple family homes and/or
apartment complexes which rent or maintain living space to two or more families
or individuals in separate and distinct living units, with each unit containing
at least one kitchen and one full bath.
   (b)    "Residential garbage and refuse" shall mean all rubbish, trash,
refuse, and garbage of any kind that has been generated from residential single
family households. "Residential garbage" shall not be construed to include
sewage wastes, tires, construction debris, or other items not normally disposed
of that do not meet the definitions in this chapter.
   (c)    "Collection of garbage" shall mean the physical act of picking up or
taking actual physical custody of garbage, rubbish or trash , whether
commercial, industrial, or residential, and transporting, directly or
indirectly, such materials to a landfill or other disposal site. The physical
act of hauling away or removing the waste shall be included within the
definition of"collection of garbage."
   (d)    "Contractor" shall mean the person, company or entity hauling
garbage, refuse, rubbish or trash.
   (e)    "Garbage" shall mean all refuse accumulations of any fruit or
vegetable matter that attended the preparation, use, work dealing in all
storage of meat, fish, fruits, or vegetables or containers originally used for
foodstuffs.
   (f)   "Rubbish" shall mean all other refuse except rocks, concrete blocks,
and similar solid material, construction debris such as drywall, wood
construction material, roofing material, siding, plaster, or dirt, and/or
similar materials.
   (g)    "Refuse" shall mean garbage, rubbish, or both.
(Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
959.03  RESIDENTIAL GARBAGE AND RUBBISH COLLECTION.
   Unless otherwise provided for and regulated, any contractor collecting
residential garbage, commercial waste, rubbish, or refuse in the City shall
comply with the requirements in this chapter. (Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
959.04  WASTE COLLECTION; FRANCHISE AGREEMENT.
   The City Manager may enter into an exclusive contract for a single
contractor for garbage collection generated by departments within the City of
Conneaut.
(Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
959.05 LICENSING OF CONTRACTORS.
   (a)   No person shall engage in garbage collection services without first
obtaining an annual license from the City Manager, said license to run from
September 1 to August 31st each year. Those haulers currently licensed by the
Board of Health shall be deemed registered until August 31, 2017.
   (b)   Those persons seeking a permit to engage in garbage collection shall
submit an application to the City Manager's Office accompanied by a licensing
fee of $1 ,500.00.
   (c)   An application for a hauling permit shall include the following
information:
      (1)   The name, address and phone number of the company, the name,
address, phone number and email address of the company representative, and the
company EIN.
      (2)   The name and address of the landfill to which trash, garbage, and
refuse are taken and unloaded.
      (3)   The name and address of the recycling center to which glass,
plastic, paper, aluminum and other recyclable materials are taken and unloaded.
      (4)   Verification that its employees are covered by Workers
Compensation, and that the contractor has liability insurance of at least $1
million dollars for the vehicles used in its hauling operation.
      (5)   Verification that the contractor has a recycling program that meets
the conditions of this chapter. (Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
      (6)    Certification that each vehicle used has passed a safety
inspection test by the Ohio State Patrol or other certified mechanic approved
by the City within 60 days of filing its application.
         (Ord. 68-17A. Passed 9-25-17.)
   (d)   An application shall be approved once it has been determined that the
applicant has satisfied all the criteria in Section
959.05(c). (Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
959.06 CONDITIONS OF HAULING PERMIT.
   (a)   A City issued hauling permit shall be conditioned upon the following:
      (1)   The Contractor shall maintain an office in Ashtabula County, Ohio,
or a contiguous County, and telephone service with a non-toll telephone number
from the City, which shall be manned by a live operator and a supervisor on
working days from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. to receive any complaints or calls
regarding the Collection Services from a Resident or the City. The Contractor
shall also maintain an emergency contact number which is available 24 hours per
day, seven (7) days per week.
      (2)    All vehicles used by the Contractor for the collection of Solid
Waste or Recyclable Materials shall be enclosed, washed and cleaned, leak-proof
(including but not limited to free from excessive leaks of fuel or hydraulic
fluid), free of rust damage (including but not limited to holes or loose metal
and equipped with a broom, shovel, rake, back-up alarm and warning lights
visible in a 360 degree arc. All vehicles shall be painted, and shall bear the
Contractor's name, vehicle number and Contractor's telephone number in a
minimum of 4 inch lettering.
      (3)   The Contractor shall furnish to the City satisfactory proof that
the Contractor has paid current premiums for workers' compensation coverage for
all persons in its employment. The Contractor shall hold the City free and
harmless for any and all personal injuries of all persons performing work for
the Contractor under this Collection Agreement.
      (4)   Offer its customers a weekly curbside recycling program in
accordance with this chapter. Each contractor shall provide the City, on a
quarterly basis, the number of customers utilizing their recycling service and
verification of the amount or weight of recyclables deposited with the facility
named in its application.
      (5)   Other provisions and requirements set forth in this chapter.
      (6)   Compliance with all local, state and federal laws including income
tax filings, workers' compensation, traffic laws, safety regulations and
sanitation laws and regulations.
      (7)   A contractor collecting refuse in the City shall call for and
remove refuse at least once each week Monday through Thursday in the City. No
refuse collection shall be allowed on Saturday or Sunday unless due to a
holiday observance or severe weather conditions. All of the collections shall
be in a clean manner. Each contractor shall clean up materials within the
right-of-way in front of the property. A contractor collecting refuse in the
City shall offer as a service to pick up one heavy item each week such as but
not limited to kitchen equipment (stoves, microwaves, dishwashers,
refrigerators must have Freon removed and tagged, electronic equipment such as
stereos, televisions, game tables, and/or similar items, interior furnishings
such as chairs, couches, mattresses, box springs, and /or similar items).
      (8)   All garbage and rubbish collected in the manner herein defined
shall be conveyed and disposed of by the contractor in a properly licensed
landfill or dropped off at a properly licensed transfer station.
      (9)   No contractor shall pick up residential refuse in a district before
5:00 a.m. and no later than 6:00 p.m.
   (b)   The City Manager may revoke a license to haul trash upon thirty day
written notice to the hauler of a violation of Section
959.05 or
959.06.
(Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
959.07 RECYCLING.
   (a)   Any contractor collecting residential garbage and refuse in the City
shall offer "source separated, single stream" collection of recyclable
materials to each residence at no cost for the following items listed. The
contractor shall pick up recyclables in a container with a lid marked
"recyclables", and/or in a container provided by the contractor. Recyclable
materials include:
      (1)   Cardboard
      (2)   Paperboard products (cereal boxes, food containers)
      (3)   Newspaper
      (4)   Mixed paper
      (5)   Junk mail
      (6)   Magazines
      (7)   Office paper
      (8)   Brown, clear, and green glass
      (9)   Steel and tin beverage and food containers
      (10)   Aluminum beverage and food containers
      (11)   Plastic beverage and food containers ( # 1-#2)
      (12)   Aluminum tin foil and food containers
      (13)   Plastic beverage and food containers (#3-#7)
   (b)    The City Manager may waive any item in the list in (a) above for all
haulers in the event that any such item is not accepted by a recycling facility
within a reasonable distance until such time as such facility agrees to accept
such item.
   (c)    The City Manager may adjust the list of recyclable items on an annual
basis in the event any such item is no longer being accepted generally for
recycling.
   (d)    The contractor shall provide written notice to the City of the name
and location of the company to which it is taking its recyclables described
above, and shall submit documentary verification that it is in fact unloading
its recyclable at such site.
(Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
959.20  DUTIES OF OWNERS, LANDLORDS AND TENANTS.
   (a)   Effective 60 days after passage, the following shall contract for
trash pickup service with a contractor licensed by the City of Conneaut:
      (1)    Owners of an owner-occupied house
      (2)    Owners of a house occupied by a tenant, unless the rental
agreement with the tenant expressly provides that the tenant shall have the
collection service.
      (3)    Owners of an occupied commercial or industrial building, unless
the rental agreement expressly provides that the tenant shall have the
collection service.
      (4)    Tenants in single dwellings or commercial or industrial buildings
where the rental agreement expressly provides that the tenant shall have
collection service.
   (b)   Residents shall only set out refuse containers at curbside after 6:00
p.m. on the day before the scheduled pickup and all containers shall be removed
by 6:00 p.m. on the day of the scheduled pickup. If said refuse is not picked
up by the contractor, the resident is responsible for removing said refuse from
the curbside by 6:00 p.m. on the day of the scheduled pickup.
   (c)   Each owner or tenant, as appropriate. shall place their garbage in an
identifiable container for trash pickup which shall be secured by a lid to keep
animals from accessing the garbage therein.
   (d)   No person shall contract with a contractor for the removal of garbage,
rubbish and trash that is not licensed by the City of Cmmeaut to do so.
   (e)   No person shall allow garbage, rubbish or trash to accumulate for more
than ten days inside or outside their home or place of business.
   (f)   No person or business utilizing a dumpster or other container for
commercial or industrial waste shall allow garbage, trash or rubbish to
accumulate outside of such container.
(Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
959.30  GENERAL PROHIBITIONS.
   No person shall:
   (a)    Ride on the outside of any vehicle engaged in hauling trash unless
such vehicle is especially designed for outside riding (eg, handles), meets
OSHA requirements and does not travel in excess of ten (10) miles per hour with
such outside riders.
   (b)   Operate any vehicle engaged in hauling trash on any street facing
traffic, or turn into private residential driveways without the express written
consent of the landowner.
      (Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
959.99 PENALTY.
   Whoever violates any provision of this chapter sha ll be punished as fo
llows:
   (a)    Anyone found violating Section
959.05 or
959.06 shall be guilty of a first degree misdemeanor, punishable by a maximum
fine of $1,000.00 and/or imprisonment for a maximum of six months.
   (b)   Anyone found violating Section
959.20(a) shall be guilty of a fourth degree misdemeanor, punishable by a
maximum fine of $250.00 and/or imprisonment for a maximum of thirty days.
      (Ord. 110-16. Passed 2-13-17.)
   (c)    Anyone found violating any provision found in Sections
959.20(b)-(f) shall be guilty of a minor misdemeanor, punishable by a fine of
$100.00 and each day of violation shall constitute a separate offense. If the
offender has previously been convicted of a violation of any provision of this
chapter, or any other similar code of the City, such violation shall be a
misdemeanor of the fourth degree.
      (Ord. 68-17A. Passed 9-25-17.)
